data.title: Marshall Amp Company - SOLD! No Longer Family Owned
data.meta_description: Iconic British guitar amp manufacturer Marshall Amps is being acquired by Swedish firm Zound Industries – the company that currently produces Marshall...
data.text:
GeneB

Tele-Afflicted

Joined

Apr 15, 2015

Posts

1,261

Age

73

Location

Tampa, FL

Iconic British guitar amp manufacturer Marshall Amps is being acquired by Swedish firm Zound Industries – the company that currently produces Marshall headphones and speakers under license from the amp brand. The Marshall family will own a 24% stake in the new company. No plans to change where they are built (Vietnam and UK).

Guitar World Article w/Details

This site may earn a commission from merchant links like Ebay, Amazon, and others.

Marshall Amps being bought out

https://www.theverge.com/2023/3/30/23660187/marshall-zound-merger-acquisition-bluetooth-headphones-speakers-amps The company who makes those Marshall-branded Bluetooth speakers is buying the Marshall company, evidently.

Actually, the family still owns 24%, making them the largest shareholder.

That does still give them quite a bit of control

I might think that gives them a voice at the table. Control????

At any rate……best of luck to them all! Marshall might want to get into modeling and miniature amps. Zound Industry might be poised to la7nch Bluetooth guitar amplification with ear buds. Can you say ‘ideal home/bedroom amp’.

I am rather technologically backwards, but my sister has hearing aids that are linked to her phone…..it rings and talks in her ear!
